properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: One day heat event for Sunday. Daytime maximum temperatures near 30 degrees Celsius are expected with overnight low temperatures in the high teens. These conditions pose a health risk when you are not used to the heat. Everyone is at risk from heat, especially older adults; infants and young children; and people with chronic illnesses. You are advised to 1) drink plenty of cool liquids before feeling thirsty; and 2) keep cool by dressing for the weather and spending a few hours each day in a cool place. Hot and humid air can bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index to approach the high risk category. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-28T18:30:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T02:31:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2344463021.2020
Area: Fort Severn
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long duration heat event is expected. Daytime high temperatures in the low to mid thirties with overnight lows near 20 are expected until the end of next week. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index to approach the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-28T18:28:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T02:29:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2699520685.2020
Area: Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park, Ear Falls - Perrault Falls - Western Lac Seul, Savant Lake - Sturgeon Lake, Sioux Lookout - Eastern Lac Seul, Kenora - Grassy Narrows - Whitedog, Sioux Narrows - Nestor Falls - Morson, Dryden - Vermilion Bay, Ignace - English River, Fort Frances - Emo - Rainy River, Seine River Village - Mine Centre

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots, frequent lightning and hail. Thunderstorms continue late this evening across Lake Manitoba as a low pressure system moves across central Manitoba. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe. ### Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-06-28T08:59:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T02:26:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1631023457.2020
Area: Lake Manitoba
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Visibilities are expected to begin to improve late tomorrow morning. ### Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-28T18:17:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T02:18:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1783211302.2020
Area: Gjoa Haven
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms continue late this evening as a cold front pushes across central Manitoba. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-28T08:59:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T03:12:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0982434590.2020
Area: Molson Lake and Bear Lake, Cross Lake and Jenpeg, Wabowden, Hwy 6 between Little Limestone Lake and Ponton, Norway House
properties.Author: Environment Canada
